info.name: Henny's Star Buffet
info.attribution:
Original layout, coding, and asset design done by Bohnanzus and released under CC0. Code modifications and functionality adjustments performed by Dexdouglas and released under CC0.

Cover image created using AI https://labs.google/fx/tools/image-fx with a prompt of "Cartoon style hen in outer space wearing space suit and with a plate of stars."
info.description: In Henny's Star Buffet, you compete with other players to have the most stars collected by the end of the game. Every round, a platter of delicious stars are served and each player needs to bid with the money they have in hand. If they don't include a tip, they are going to get the lowest offering available.
info.ruleText:
The game consists of 110 cards (17 money cards of value 1-5, and 25 gray “tip” cards of value 5). 30 star tiles (3x0, and 16-42 with 1-9 stars on each tile)


You are all hens in outer space with a hankering for some stars. The objective is to end the game with more stars on your plate than any other player. You start the game with 6 money cards and you only replenish your hand minimally each turn so be careful with how and when you choose to play your cards. If you don’t play a grey “tip” card for the server, you will always get the lowest valued star tile there is, no matter how much money you are spending. 


After everyone is seated and you select the number of players in a game, deal star tiles (plates) to the center of the board. The star tiles have two pieces of info, the number value on the top, and the # of stars on the bottom. The stars are the points that you count at the end of the game. 


In turn order, you play any number of cards from your hand that are all the same color. You do not have to play all of the cards of the same color that you have in your hand, but you are only permitted to play this selected color once in a round. Once you have played cards, update your total so everyone can see, then draw a card by hitting the +1. It doesn’t matter how many cards you play, you will only ever draw 1 after playing a turn. 


If you do not, or can not play any more in a round, you can pass. If you are not the last person to pass, you will draw 2 cards. If you are the last person to pass, you will not draw any additional cards.


When you pass, if you do not have at least one grey 5 “tip” card played in front of you, you will immediately take the lowest valued star tile in the center. You will not collect any more star tiles this round. You can then discard your cards from your bid area. 


If you pass and you DO have at least one grey 5 tip card in front of you, you will first assess if your total played value is equal to anyone’s top star tile they have collected. If it is, the server will immediately collect it from that player and place it in your stack. If not, then hold tight until everyone else has passed as well. 


**NOTE** Even if you pass, you can still have star tiles stolen from you. 


Once everyone has passed, those with grey 5 tip cards in front of them will then be served a plate of delicious stars. The highest value played will get the highest value star tile, the second highest will get the second highest star tile, and so on. In the event of a tie, the grey tip card with the highest number in the center will be considered the highest. 


Once everyone has collected their star tiles, discard all your cards from the bid area, and the start player will be the last player who collected a star tile in the previous round (usually the lowest value bid with a grey card). The next round begins with more star tiles being dealt to the center of the table. Continue like this until there are no more star tiles in the deck. The winner is the one with the highest total number of stars collected on their tiles. In the event of a tie. The player with the highest value star tile is the winner.
info.helpText:
How to play

Click to sit at any seat. When all players are seated, click the number of players on the middle right to deal out a starting hand of 6 cards to each player, assign a start player (glowing name), and load the domino holder with tiles for the game. Depending on how many players you have, you will have 18, 24, 28, or 30 tiles in the stack. Press the “Deal One” button in the center of the table until there are a number of tiles equal to the number of players in the game.

Drag cards from your hand to your bid holder next to your name. After playing any number of cards, update the total of your cards in your bid by adjusting the value next to your name. Then press the “+1” button to draw a card and pass the turn to the next player. 

If you are not playing any cards and you are not the last player in the round to pass, then press the “Pass & +2” button to pass your turn and draw 2 cards. For the rest of the round, when the turn comes to you, just press the “pass” button to do nothing and pass the turn.

When all tiles are distributed for the round, press the “Deal one” button until you have as many tiles as players. Then press the “pass” button until you have highlighted the player whose turn it is in the new round (the player who last took a tile in the previous round). 


If you need to discard the cards in your bid holder, press the “Discard” button next to your name. This will move the cards to the Discard holder. When the draw deck is empty, press the “Shuffle discard” button to shuffle the discards and place them face downy on the draw stack.


When you win a tile, drag it to the small rectangular holder next to your name. As you win more tiles, you will stack them on top of each other in this holder. Players are able to steal tiles from this holder if they pass while bidding with a grey card, and their total equals the number value on your top-most tile. Multiple people can steal from a player in a turn and a tile can be stolen multiple times in a game, or even a round. 


The game ends at the end of the round when there are no more tiles to auction off in the center. When this happens, drag each of your tiles from your holder to your bid area for all to see and tally up the # of stars that you have collected. The player with the highest # of stars is the winner. If tied, the player with the higher numbered star tile is the winner.
